front.title: RPKI Autonomous Systems Cones: A Profile To Define Sets of Autonomous Systems Numbers To Facilitate BGP Filtering

abstract.t: This document describes a way to define groups of Autonomous System numbers in RPKI , also known as AS-Cones. They provide a mechanism to be used by operators for filtering purposes using BGP-4 .

section.title: Introduction
section.t: The main goal of the RPKI system is to provide additional security to the global routing system. This is achieved through the use of information stored in Route Object Authorisation (ROAs), which describe the prefixes originated by ASNs. There is however no way for an operator to assert the routes for networks adjacent to it, making it difficult to use the information carried by RPKI to create meaningful BGP-4 filters. This memo introduces a new attestation object, called an AS-Cone. An AS-Cone is a digitally signed object with the goal to enable operators to define a set of customers that can be found as "right adjacencies", or transit customer networks, facilitating the construction of prefix filters for a given ASn, and making routing more secure.
